result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called for plea and sentencing.  
Defense requests an adjournment.

Defense requests plea and sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.

09:21 AM Defendant Andrew C Nord in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Charles Patrick Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense is waiting for discovery. 
  Hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

08:24 AM Defendant Andrew C Nord in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
